title: VR-Based In-Depth Mathematics Concept Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics fundamentals and high school algebra/geometry knowledge
context.additional_context: VR Math Modeling in BYOD Environments; Concretizing Abstract Concepts through Multisensory Learning

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain spatial relationships in three-dimensional geometric structures with 85% accuracy using VR learning objects.
Learners can apply the principles of graph transformations for quadratic functions in virtual reality to over three real-world cases.
Learners can provide feedback on complex mathematical problem-solving processes according to peer assessment rubrics through VR-based collaborative simulations.

resources: Compatible VR Headsets (Low-Cost Solutions like Google Cardboard)
Licensed VR Software for Visualizing Mathematical Concepts

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
